title: Sahel
summary: The Sahel (/səˈhɛl/; Arabic: ساحل‎ sāḥil [ˈsaːħil], "coast, shore")[1] is the ecoclimatic and biogeographic realm of transition in Africa between the Sahara to the north and the Sudanian savanna to the south. Having a semi-arid climate, it stretches across the south-central latitudes of Northern Africa between the Atlantic Ocean and the Red Sea.
